comments.author: witcher_sense
comments.body: Quote from: Fullbear2222 on November 10, 2022, 12:13:27 PMYes they are difficult to use most easy Are blockchain.This is the reason why exchangers still popular Can you tell one safe and secure btc wallet ? Wich one is safe?Exchanges are still popular because people are still more into speculating with digital assets than hodling. For this reason, the bitcoin maximalists (people who will not sell no matter what happens on the market) make up a very small percentage of all cryptocurrency users, who are mostly gambling with their digital money. Also, some people erroneously believe that those who work on exchanges are more technically literate in matters of cryptocurrency management: funds are safer when on "hosted" wallets managed by centralized entities. Of course, this is a total misconception. Decentralized custody of many owners of independent wallets is the key to security. As for the difficulty of use, I can say that setting up your personal wallet requires much fewer steps and interactions than setting up your exchange account and undergoing different verification procedures to make your account "work."

That doesn't mean they are the majority just because the rest are mostly silent.

comments.author: DanWalker
comments.body: Quote from: Fullbear2222 on November 10, 2022, 12:13:27 PMYes they are difficult to use most easy Are blockchain.This is the reason why exchangers still popular Can you tell one safe and secure btc wallet ? Wich one is safe?Actually, using a non-custodial wallet or an exchange wallet has nothing to do with difficulty or ease of use, the difference lies in the purpose of use. People who leave their bitcoins or cryptocurrencies on centralized exchanges are mostly traders, very few holders will leave bitcoins on the exchange. Nowadays, people not only invest in bitcoin, many also invest in altcoins and the fact that each stored coin needs a separate wallet makes it very difficult to control the asset. So people tend to have them all on a centralized exchange, which is convenient for trading as well as managing them. I have also used blockchain.info wallet, coinbase...but if for storing bitcoins Electrum wallet is the best and easiest to use I found, and for those with higher security needs, they will tend to choose hardware wallets for themselves.
